ArticleTitle.sentence: Heat shock induces HIV-1 replication in chronically infected promyelocyte cell line OM10.1.

event.clue: Heat shock induces HIV-1 replication in chronically infected promyelocyte cell line OM10.1.

AbstractText.sentence: A long period of clinical latency before development of symptoms is characteristic of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1) infection.

event.clue: A long period of clinical latency before development of symptoms is characteristic of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1) infection.

AbstractText.sentence: OM10.1, a promyelocyte cell line latently infected with HIV-1, has been developed as a model for studying the mechanism of viral latency and the activation of virus expression.

event.clue: OM10.1, a promyelocyte cell line latently infected with HIV-1, has been developed as a model for studying the mechanism of viral latency and the activation of virus expression.

AbstractText.sentence: We found that this latently infected cell line with heat shock at 42 degrees C for 2 h resulted in a high level of HIV-1 production without addition of any cytokines.

event.clue: We found that this latently infected cell line with heat shock at 42 degrees C for 2 h resulted in a high level of HIV-1 production without addition of any cytokines.

AbstractText.sentence: The mechanism of activation was analyzed by using anti-TNF-alpha antibody and various inhibitors.

Although the TNF-alpha level in culture supernatants was below the sensitivity of an ELISA assay system, addition of anti-TNF-alpha antibody in culture medium could partially suppress the heat shock induced HIV-1 production.

event.clue: Although the TNF-alpha level in culture supernatants was below the sensitivity of an ELISA assay system, addition of anti-TNF-alpha antibody in culture medium could partially suppress the heat shock induced HIV-1 production.

AbstractText.sentence: Staurosporine (PKC inhibitor), pentoxifylline (NF-kappa B inhibitor), and Ro5-3335 (HIV-1 Tat inhibitor) also inhibited significantly the heat shock induced virus activation.

AbstractText.sentence: In particular, staurosporine achieved approximately 90% inhibition of the HIV-1 antigen expression in heat shock-treated OM10.1 at a non-toxic concentration.

AbstractText.sentence: Although the mechanism of HIV-1 activation with heat shock has not been fully elucidated yet, it is presumed PKC plays an important role in HIV-1 activation.

AbstractText.sentence: Thus, the present observations will provide a further insight into the pathogenesis of HIV-1 infections.
